betterquesting:10.desc:8:
All the things you've discovered so far, yet you know that this is only the beginning. You'll need to start writing things down... but you're lazy. And you have a wand. So why not try a magical way to "write down" your discoveries?

You try using your wand on a single book in vein. So you seek out the Thaumaturge you met before, and ask what you're doing wrong. With a smirk he explains that one book alone isn't enough. A full bookshelf is needed.

You try again, and this time the bookshelf yields to your wand, turning into a shining, floating book in the process.

Grabbing the Thaumonomicon, as the mage explains that book is called, you give him a meaningful look. He merely nods in understanding, knowing full well what you were about to ask.
